2_1G6QESmeipZsukJX5WvDxxwSioaGnEDRk3.body:
> [sirius17](#comment_3_1G6QESmeipZsukJX5WvDxxwSioaGnEDRk3): The NASA website has an API that allows anyone to download APoD. My server grabs this data every day, re-compiles it, create a simple website, signs it and then publishes it to ZeroNet - simple !

Why not add to an existing website, or a `data.json`-File/ Database?
That would assure, that everybody can view every picture one *one* Zite!
Also, it would ensure enough peers all the time, as there would be no need to download a completely new Zite..
:?
